trait.name: Insanity
trait.text: The derro has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Hooked Shortspear
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4-1) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, the derro can choose to deal no damage and try to trip the target instead, in which case the target must succeed on a DC 9 Strength saving throw or fall prone.

action.name: Light Repeating Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage.

monster.name: Derro Savant

trait.name: Insanity
trait.text: The derro has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The derro is a 5th-level spellcaster. It's spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The derro knows the following sorcerer spells:
Cantrips (at will): acid splash, light, mage hand, message, ray of frost
1st level (4 slots): burning hands, chromatic orb, sleep
2nd level (3 slots): invisibility, spider climb
3rd level (2 slots): blink, lightning bolt

action.name: Hooked Shortspear
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4-1) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, the derro can choose to deal no damage and try to trip the target instead, in which case the target must succeed on a DC 9 Strength saving throw or fall prone.

action.name: Light Repeating Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage.

monster.spells: acid splash, light, mage hand, message, ray of frost, burning hands, chromatic orb, sleep, invisibility, spider climb, blink, lightning bolt

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Barbed Tail
reaction.text: When a creature provokes an opportunity attack from the ixitxachitl, the ixitxachitl can make the following attack instead of using its bite.
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.name: Ixitxachitl Cleric

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The ixtachitl is a 5th-level spellcaster that uses Wisdom as its spellcasting ability (Spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). The ixitxachil has the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): guidance, thaumaturgy
1st level (4 slots): charm person, create or destroy water
2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence
3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, tongues

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Barbed Tail
reaction.text: When a creature provokes an opportunity attack from the ixitxachitl, the ixitxachitl can make the following attack instead of using its bite.
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.spells: guidance, thaumaturgy, charm person, create or destroy water, hold person, silence, dispel magic, tongues

action.name: Vampiric Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken, and the ixitxachitl regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

reaction.name: Barbed Tail
reaction.text: When a creature provokes an opportunity attack from the ixitxachitl, the ixitxachitl can make the following attack instead of using its bite.
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

monster.name: Vampiric Ixitxachitl Cleric

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The ixtachitl is a 5th-level spellcaster that uses Wisdom as its spellcasting ability (Spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). The ixitxachil has the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): guidance, thaumaturgy
1st level (4 slots): charm person, create or destroy water
2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence
3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, tongues

action.name: Vampiric Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken, and the ixitxachitl regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

reaction.name: Barbed Tail
reaction.text: When a creature provokes an opportunity attack from the ixitxachitl, the ixitxachitl can make the following attack instead of using its bite.
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

monster.spells: guidance, thaumaturgy, charm person, create or destroy water, hold person, silence, dispel magic, tongues

monster.name: Duergar Darkhaft

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
trait.text: The darkhaft's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 10) it can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: friends, mage hand
1/day each: disguise self, sleep

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: War Pick
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, or 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it .

monster.spells: friends, mage hand, disguise self, sleep

trait.name: Mounted
trait.text: The vicious kavalrachni are the duergar cavalry of Gracklstugh, riding giant tarantualas known as steeders (see the female steeder stat block)

trait.name: Cavalry Training
trait.text: When the duergar hits a target with a melee attack while mounted on a female steeder, the steeder can make a melee attack agains the same target as a reaction.

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, or 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it .

monster.name: Duergar Keeper of the Flame

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
trait.text: The Keeper of the Flame's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12.) It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: friends, message
1/day: command

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The Keeper of the Flame is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The Keeper of the Flame has the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, sacred flame
1st level (4 slots): bane, inflict wounds, shield of faith
2nd level (2 slots): enhance ability, spiritual weapon

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
trait.text: The duergar's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: blade ward, true strike
1/day each: jump, hunter's mark

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Create Soulblade
action.text: The duergar creates a visible, shortword-sized blade of psionic energy. The weapon appears int he duergar's hand and vanishes if it leaves the duergar's grip, or if the duergar dies or is incapacitated.

action.name: Soulblade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attackk: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) force damage, or 10 (2d6 + 3) force damage while enlarged. If the soulblade has advantage on the attack roll, th eattack deals an extra 3 (1d6) force damage.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it .

action.text: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it .

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
trait.text: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Fire Lance
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit (with ddisadvantage if the target is within 5 feet of the duergar), reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage, or 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage while enlarged.

action.name: Fire Spray (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: From its fire lance, the duergar shoots a 15-foot cone of fire or a line of fire 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it .

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spore servant makes two pincer attacks.

action.name: Pincer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (Escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the spore servant doesn't have two other creatures grappled.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: War Pick
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spore servant makes two hyook attacks.

action.name: Hook
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

trait.name: Chameleon Skin
trait.text: The troglodyte has aadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Stench
trait.text: Any creature other than a ttroglodyte that starts its turn within 5 feet of the troglodyte must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all ttroglodytes for 1 hour.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the troglodyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troglodyte makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with either its claws or its greatclub.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Greatclub
action.text: Melee Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Acid Spray (Recharge 6)
action.text: The troglodyte spits acid in a line 15 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Awakened Zurkhwood
monster.languages: one language known by its creator

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the tree remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal zurkhwood mushroom.

trait.name: Mute
trait.text: If the awakened zurkhwood was created by a myconid sovereign, it can't speak.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Fungus Stride
trait.text: Once on its turn, the bridesmaid can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living mushroom or fungus patch within 5 feet and emerge from another winin 60 feet of the first one, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second mushroom or fungus patch. The mushrooms and patches must be large or bigger.

action.name: Hallucination Spores
action.text: The bridesmaid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is incapacitated. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)
action.text: The bridesmaid releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfecte, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).

trait.name: Mushroom Portal
trait.text: The chamberlain counts as a mushroom for the Fungus Stride feature of the bridesmaid of Zuggtmoy.

trait.name: Poison Spores
trait.text: Whenever the chamberlain takes damage, it releases a cloud of spores. Creatures within 5 feet of the chamberlain when this happens must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the savng throw at t ehe end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Hallucination Spores
action.text: The bridesmaid ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is incapacitated. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The chamberlain makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: =5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)
action.text: The chanberlain releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfecte, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The steeder can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Leap
trait.text: The steeder can expend all its movement on iuts turn to jump up to 90 feet vertically or horizontally, provided that is speed is at least 30 feet.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) acid damage on a faile dsave, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Sticky Leg (Recharges when the Steeder Has No Creatures Grappled
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: The target is stuck ot the steeder's leg and grappled until it escapes (escape DC 12)

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The steeder can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Leap
trait.text: The steeder can expend all its movement on iuts turn to jump up to 60 feet vertically or horizontally, provided that is speed is at least 30 feet.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) acid damage on a faile dsave, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Sticky Leg (Recharges when the Steeder Has No Creatures Grappled
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Small or Tiny creature. Hit: The target is stuck ot the steeder's leg and grappled until it escapes (escape DC 12)

monster.name: Droki
monster.speed: 30 ft. (60 ft. with boots of speed)

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Droki wears boots of speed

trait.name: Insanity
trait.text: Droki has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Droki's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: minor illusion
1/day each: darkness, fear, shatter

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
trait.text: Droki deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage ont he attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Droki that isn't incapacitated and Droki doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Droki makes two attacks with his shortsword

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. The sword is coated with serpent venom that wears off after the first hit. A target subjected to the venom must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: Droki adds 3 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, Droki must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.name: Grisha
monster.type: humanoid (Damaran human), out of the abyss

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Grisha is a 6th-level-spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): guidance, light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, divine favor, inflict wounds, protection from good, shield of faith
2nd level (3 slots): continual flame, hold person, magic weapon, spiritual weapon
3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, dispel magic, spirit guardian

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Grisha makes two attacks with his +1 flail.

action.name: +1 Flail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage

monster.spells: guidance, light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy, cure wounds, divine favor, inflict wounds, protection from evil and good, shield of faith, continual flame, hold person, magic weapon, spiritual weapon, bestow curse, dispel magic, spirit guardian

monster.name: Narrak

trait.name: Insanity
trait.text: Droki has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Narrak is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (Save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks) Narrak has two 2nd-level spell slots, which he regains after finishing ashort or long rest, and knows the following Warlock spells:
Cantrips (at will): eldritch blast, friends, poison spray
1st level: armor of Agathys, charm person, hex
2nd level: hold person, ray of enfeeblement, spider climb

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Armor of Shadows (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: Narrak casts mage armor on himself

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

reaction.name: One with Shadows
reaction.text: While he is in adim light or darkness, Narrak can become invisible. He remains so until he moves or takes an action or reaction.

monster.spells: eldritch blast, friends, poison spray, armor of agathys, charm person ,hex, hold person, ray of enfeeblement, spider climb

monster.name: The Pudding King
monster.type: humanoid (gnome, shapechanger), out of the abyss

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
trait.text: The Pudding King has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
trait.text: The Pudding King has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The Pudding King's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 12). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: nondetection (self only)
1/day each: blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self

trait.name: Insanity
trait.text: The Pudding King has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The Pudding King is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The Pudding King knows the following sorcerer spells:
Cantrips (at will): acid splash, light, mage hand, poison spray, prestidigitation
1st level (4 slots): false life, mage armor, ray of sickness, shield
2nd level (3 slots): crown of madness, misty step
3rd level (3 slots): gaseous form, stinking cloud
4th level (3 slots): blight, confusion
5th level (1 slot): cloudkill

action.name: War Pick
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

action.name: Change Shape
action.text: The Pudding King magically transforms into an ooze, or back into his true form. He reverts to his true form if he dies. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying is absorbed by the new form. In ooze form, the Pudding King retains his alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. His statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form.

action.name: Create Green Slime (Recharges after a Long Rest)
action.text: The Pudding King creates a patch of green slime (see "Dungeon Hazards" in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide). The slime appears on a section of wall, ceiling, or floor within 30 feet of the Pudding King.

monster.spells: acid splash, light, mage hand, poison spray, prestidigitation, false life, mage armor, ray of sickness, shield, crown of madness, misty step, gaseous form, stinking cloud, blight, confusion, cloudkill

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
trait.text: If Yestabrod fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (3d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (3d4) poison damage.

action.name: Caustic Spores (1/Day)
action.text: Yestabrod releases spores in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw ortake 1d6 acid damage at the start of each of Yestbrod's turns. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)
action.text: Yestabrod releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfecte, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).

legendary.text: Yestabrod can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Yestabrod regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Corpse Burst
legendary.text: Gore, offal, and acid erupt from a corpse within 20 feet of Yestabrod. Creatures within 10 feet of the corpse must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 7 (2d6) acid damage.

legendary.name: Foul Absorption
legendary.text: Yestabrod absorbs pullrescence from a corpse within 5 feet of it, regainign 1d8 + 2 hit points

monster.name: Baphomet
monster.immune: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing that is nonmagical

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If Baphomet moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 22 (4d10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 25 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Baphomet's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components
At will: detect magic
3/day each: dispel magic, dominate beast, hunter's mark, maze, wall of stone
1/day each: teleport

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
trait.text: Baphomet can perfectly recall any path he has traveled, and he is immune to the maze spell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Baphomet fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Baphomet has advantage on saving throws against spell and other magic effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapon
trait.text: Baphomet's weapon attacks are magical

trait.name: Reckless
trait.text: At the start of his turn, Baphomet can gain avantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Baphomet makes three attacks: one with Heartcleaver, one with his bite, and one with his gore attack.

action.name: Heartcleaver
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d6 + 10) slashing damage

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d8+10) piercing damage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) piericng damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
action.text: Each creature of Baphomet's choice within 120 feet of him and aware of him must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on tiself on a success. These later saves have disadvantage if Baphomet is within line of sight of the creature.
If a creature succeeds on any of these saves or the effect ends on it, the creature is immune is Baphomet's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary.text: Baphomet can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creautre's turn. Baphomet regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Heartcleaver attack
legendary.text: Baphomet makes a melee attack with Heartcleaver.

legendary.name: Charge (Costs 2 actions)
legendary.text: Baphomet moves up to his speed, then makes a gore attack.

monster.name: Demogorgon
monster.immune: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing that is nonmagical

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Demogorgon's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 23). Demogorgon can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components
At will: detect magic, major image
3/day each: dispel magic, fear, telekinesis
1/day each: feeblemind, project image

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Demogorgon fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Demogorgon has advantage on saving throws against spell and other magic effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapon
trait.text: Demogorgon's weapon attacks are magical

trait.name: Two Heads
trait.text: Demogorgon has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, defened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Demogorgon makes two tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 35 (4d12 + 9) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 23 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

action.name: Gaze
action.text: Demogorgon turns his magical gaze toward one creature that he can see within 120 feet of him. That target must make a DC 23 Wisdom saving throw. Unless the target is incapacitated, it can avert its eyes to avoid the gaze and to automatically succeed on the save. If the target does so, it can't see Demogorgon until the start of his next turn. If the target looks at him in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the target fails the save, the target suffers one of the following effects of Demogorgon's choice or at random:
1. Beguiling Gaze. The target is stunned until the start of Demogorgon's next turn or until Demogorgon is no longer within line of sight.

2. Hypnotic Gaze. The target is charmed by Demogorgon until the start of Demogorgon's next turn. Demogorgon chooses how the charmed target uses its actions, reactions, and movement. Because this gaze requires Demogorgon to focus both heads on the target, he can't use his Maddening Gaze legendary action until the start of his next turn.

3. Insanity Gaze. The target suffers the effect of the confusion spell without making a saving throw. The effect lasts until the start of Demogorgon's next turn. Demogorgon doesn't need to concentrate on the spell.

legendary.text: Demogorgon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creautre's turn. Demogorgon regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Tail
legendary.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 31 (4d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 22 (4d10) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Maddening Gaze
legendary.text: Demogorgon uses his Gaze action, and must choose either the Beguiling Gaze or the Insanity Gaze effect.

monster.spells: detect magic, major image, dispel magic, fear, telekinesis, feeblemind, project image
